SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A unique code assigned by an affiliated governing body or other organization that identifies a specific protocol (e.g., grant number, national number).
The short descriptive name for the protocol.
The formal descriptive name for the protocol.
A written description of a change(s) to, or formal clarification of, a protocol. (ICH E6)
A person who is the writer of a structured research study protocol.
A scientific summary of the key points of the protocol.
The descriptive name of the protocol that is intended for the lay public, written in easily understood language.
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Study Protocol Document Version Public Title

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A unique code assigned by a clinical trial registry that identifies a specific protocol.

A standardized representation of planned clinical trial activities including interventions (e.g., administering drug, surgery) and study administrative activities (e.g., obtaining informed consent, distributing clinical trial material and diaries, randomization) as well as assessments. (CDISC Glossary)
A more extensive descriptive name of the protocol that is intended for medical professionals, written using medical and scientific language.
A unique code assigned by the sponsor that identifies a specific protocol.
A word or words formed from the beginning letters or a combination of syllables and letters of a compound term, which identifies a clinical study.
The date on which a version of the protocol was finalized or approved by the study oversight committee.
SKOS_CONCEPT.notation: Study Protocol Version Approval by Oversight Committee Date
SKOS_CONCEPT.pref_label: Study Protocol Version Approval by Oversight Committee Date

SKOS_CONCEPT.alt_label: Protocol Amendment Approval by Sponsor Date;Study Protocol Version Approval Date
SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: The date on which a version of the protocol was finalized or approved by the sponsor.
SKOS_CONCEPT.notation: Study Protocol Version Approval by Sponsor Date

SKOS_CONCEPT.definition: A plan at a particular point in time for a formal investigation to assess the utility, impact, pharmacological, physiological, and/or psychological effects of a particular treatment, procedure, drug, device, biologic, food product, cosmetic, care plan, or subject characteristic. (BRIDG)
